vocabularyDefinition.en: Diameter of the borehole as a function of the depth.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Diameter of the borehole as a function of the depth.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: The course of the diameter is represented as a Discrete Curve range, i.e. it changes into discrete steps (intervals) as a function of the depth.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Reference to the description of the borehole diameter for a given depth interval.

vocabularyUsageNote.en: By "ground" we mean the part of the earth's crust below the earth's surface. It refers to both the soil and what is underneath it (and is called subsoil here).

vocabularyUsageNote.en: In this context, we limit ourselves to soil samples obtained by means of a soil drilling. The observation is usually done in a lab.

vocabularyDefinition.en: Place where the Sample is stored.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: This is typically an indirect indication of the location, e.g. a reference to the Organisation where the Sample is kept and possibly its position within it (shelf in a storage or drawer in a museum).
